availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Tamar [Unknown] (Former enslaved person in Louisville, Kentucky)

body.p: Indiana, formerly enslaved woman. Kentucky native. Enslaved by Alfred Lawrence Shotwell in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1851. Escaped with the aid of Calvin Fairbank to Indiana in 1851.

ab.bibl:
J. Blaine Hudson, Fugitive Slaves and the Underground Railroad in the Kentucky Borderland (Jefferson, NC: McFarland and Co, 2002), 134-35.
Rev. Calvin Fairbank During Slavery Times: How He “Fought the Good Fight” to Prepare “The Way”; Edited from His Manuscript (Chicago, IL: R. R. McCabe & Co., 1890), 85-92.
J. Blaine Hudson, Fugitive Slaves and the Underground Railroad in Kentucky (Jefferson, NC: McFarland and Co, 2011), 134-35.
